channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: UK finance chiefs are banging the drum for one major reform to boost economic growth
item.description: U.K. finance chiefs are banging the drum for pension reforms to boost anaemic investment and growth in the country.

item.title: China's Xi and top leaders call for halting real estate decline, responding to public concerns
item.description: While the meeting readout did not provide many details, it is significant for a country where policy directives are determined at the very top.

item.title: Major global chip stocks rally on Micron's 15% surge; ASML up 4%
item.description: Micron shares rose 15% in after-hours trade in the U.S. on Wednesday, sparking a rally

item.title: Putin reveals new rules on nuclear weapons in Russia's latest warning to the West
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Moscow's position on when it can consider using nuclear weapons could change imminently.

item.title: Google backs a startup that aims to bring mixed reality to any car windshield or plane cockpit
item.description: Distance Technologies, a Helsinki-based mixed-reality startup, raised 10 million euros of funding in a round led by GV, the venture capital arm of Alphabet.

item.title: Grubhub-owner Just Eat Takeaway to deliver sex toys in partnership with adult retailer Lovehoney
item.description: Grubhub-owner Just Eat Takeaway.com has partnered with sex toy retailer Lovehoney Group, in an unexpected expansion into the so-called sexual wellness sector.

item.title: Cathay Pacific bans couple after video showed inflight dispute over reclined seat
item.description: A video of the incident shows a couple taunting, using vulgar gestures and jostling the chair of a female passenger who reclined her seat on a long-haul flight.

item.title: Podcast: How pro video gaming, or esports, is taking off with big dollars behind it
item.description: In August, the first ever Esports World Cup concluded. It featured more than 1,500 players and a prize pool of $60 million.

item.title: Bank of Japan board members split over monetary policy path, meeting minutes show
item.description: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.

item.title: Swiss central bank cuts rates by a quarter point in third trim this year
item.description: It was the first major Western central bank to reduce interest rates back in March.

item.title: H&M shares fall as much as 8% on profit miss and scrapped earnings margin target
item.description: Shares of H&M tumbled as much as 8% on Thursday after the world's second-largest listed fashion retailer posted a miss on operating profit.

item.title: Japan's largest rice shortage in years is exacerbated by sushi-hungry tourists, weather
item.description: Japanese rice is a key staple in many of its iconic dishes, but the country is facing its biggest shortfall in years.

item.title: These are the top 10 emerging startups in India in 2024, according to LinkedIn
item.description: Zepto topped LinkedIn's 2024 Top Startups in India list.

item.title: France's biggest lender says there are 'too many' European banks as UniCredit moves on Commerzbank
item.description: BNP Paribas Chief Financial Officer Lars Machenil on Thursday voiced his support for greater integration in Europe's banking sector.

item.title: Klarna partners with fellow fintech Adyen to bring buy now, pay later into physical stores
item.description: Klarna said Thursday that it had entered into an agreement with Adyen to add its buy now, pay later products to physical payment terminals.

item.title: UniCredit's pursuit of Commerzbank reflects a watershed moment for Europe — and its banking union
item.description: European banking's latest takeover battle is widely regarded as a potential turning point for the region — particularly the bloc's incomplete banking union.

item.title: Not just China, Trump 2.0 could spell trouble for U.S. allies as he doubles down on tariff talk
item.description: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: AI-adjacent companies may be the next big play
item.description: The AI wave will ripple throughout the ocean for some time. Big Tech or semiconductors are juicy catches, but a wider net might reel in other prizes.

item.title: India wants to become a semiconductor powerhouse, but it can't do it on its own
item.description: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.

item.title: SK Hynix shares jump as company announces mass production of updated AI chip
item.description: The South Korean giant has been a main supplier of the high-bandwidth memory chips catering to AI chipsets for companies like Nvidia.

item.title: Australia's inflation rate has come within its target range, but rate cuts likely won't come anytime soon
item.description: The RBA had expected inflation to fall. RBA Gov. Michelle Bullock said that inflation is expected to climb above the target range again when government reliefs expire.

item.title: China offers one-time cash allowance for those in extreme poverty
item.description: China announced it will offer a one-time cash allowance to those in extreme poverty, after it rolled out a slate of stimulus aimed at shoring up the economy.

item.title: Trump says Zelenskyy insulted him; House GOP to probe Ukraine leader's PA trip
item.description: House Republicans will probe Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's visit to an ammunition factory in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Fearful of the 'middle-income trap,' Indonesia pushes for major policy reform
item.description: The nation's finance minister said its yearly 5% GDP growth of is "not enough" for Indonesia to achieve the progress needed to become a high-income country.

item.title: OpenAI considering restructuring to for-profit, CTO Mira Murati and two top research execs depart
item.description: OpenAI's board is considering plans to restructure the firm to a for-profit business. CTO Mira Murati and two top research execs said they are leaving.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Time to look at AI-adjacent plays
item.description: The AI wave will ripple throughout the ocean for some time. Big Tech or semiconductors are juicy catches, but a wider net might reel in other prizes.

item.title: FBI searches NYC Mayor Eric Adams' home Gracie Mansion, after he is indicted in federal case
item.description: There are multiple federal investigations into New York City Mayor Eric Adams, members of his administration and people connected to the Democrat.

item.title: Meta unveils $299 Quest 3S VR headset, Orion AR glasses prototype
item.description: Meta announced the Quest 3S, the latest virtual-reality headset to come out of the company's Reality Labs division and a cheaper offering than its predecessor.

item.title: Surging AI demand could cause the world's next chip shortage, research says
item.description: A surge in demand for AI semiconductors and AI-enabled smartphones and laptops could lead to the next global chip shortage, according to Bain & Company.

item.title: Etihad reveals $7 billion investment plan over five years, will retrofit old Boeing jets
item.description: Etihad's Group Chief Executive Officer Antonoaldo Neves revealed passengers should expect "a totally different airline" within the next two to three years.
